text: The system shall support role-based access for security controls.
The system shall implement a user class hierarchy to identify the roles that different users fulfill within the hospital.
The system shall allow user classes to be defined hospital-wide or more narrowly for a specific service.
The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
The system shall require the entry of an access code and a verify code to gain access to the system.
The system shall allow users who hold any of the ORES/ORELSE/PROVIDER keys to be viewed as a clinical user and has full access privileges to all problem list options.
Clinician should have proper identification/authorization to access patient-specific information everywhere such information exists;
Clinician should have proper identification/authorization to access and review patient-specific information
methods to enforce data access authorization policies.
Authenticate and verify as ordering clinician or provider of care: May include provider identification and validation of credentials, privileges and/or other authorization.
The system shall ask the user if the user wants to continue using the system before timing out.
System should record a log everytime View medical records transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Authenticate users transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Enter/edit personal health information transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Document office visit transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Create/disable patient or HCP transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Diagnosis code transaction is performed
Access to each chart is logged, there are varying levels of auditing that can be turned on - such as auditing opening a form
Custom auditing can be plugged in for various events.
The system audit trail shall automatically capture system data changes, edits, charged, credits by all users.
The system shall support audit capability.
The system shall audit sensitive records, enabling a site to follow up on a record accessed by a remote location.
Log interaction with data repository
Log receipt and storage of lab test results
Log interaction with locator system
Log receipt of lab test results: Include patient consent information in log.
Log interaction with locator service
Log interaction with clinician
Submit authentication: Establish clinician s identity and verify whether clinician is a provider of care
One of many authentication methods could be used (biometrics, card, token or user ID and password, cryptographic techniques).
Authenticate clinician requesting laboratory test results
Establish clinician s identity and verify status as ordering clinician or provider of care.
Note that the clinician may be an individual, an organization or  system.  The nature of the identification/authentication will be different in each case.

Submit authentication information to locator system: Establish clinician s identity and verify whether clinician is a provider of care Note that the clinician may be an individual, an organization or  system .
Individual fields can be encrypted.
Verify integrity of test result (file) contents and that the results came from the identified source.
methods to ensure the veracity of data,
Authorize release of laboratory test results: Test results released to clinician based on verification as ordering clinician or provider of care status and other appropriate restrictions for use.
The secrecy of the content is maintained during transmission.
methods to correctly match patients across systems.
Clinician should be able to uniquely identify patient for which information has been requested;
